channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Global industrial robot market contracted 5.8% last year, reports Interact Analysis
item.description: Industrial robot demand and output will continue to rise in Asia-Pacific, but Europe is lagging, noted Interact Analysis. The post Global industrial r...

item.title: MOTOR Ai gets seed funding toward explainable self-driving software
item.description: MOTOR Ai is scaling its Level 4 autonomous driving software to be deployed in German public transport this year. The post MOTOR Ai gets seed funding t...

item.title: What Powell needs to do to fend off Trump and keep the Fed independent — for now
item.description: The Trump administration’s attacks on the Fed highlight the problems with Fed discretion and obscurity.

item.title: ‘We are acquaintances, not friends’: My neighbors need somewhere to stay after a house fire. Do I say yes?
item.description: “We feel obliged to offer our house to this couple to live in while they deal with this horrible experience.”

item.title: The Download: California’s AI power plans, and and why it’s so hard to make welfare AI fair
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. California i...

item.title: Alphabet’s latest deal reveals the hottest area of AI right now
item.description: As the AI talent wars escalate, Google’s new arrangement with startup Windsurf shows tech companies see a lot of value in coding assistants.

item.title: MicroStrategy’s stock surges as bitcoin buys resume, lifting holdings to above 600,000
item.description: MicroStrategy is buying bitcoin again after taking a one-week break. It now owns more than 600,000 bitcoin, valued at more than $73 billion.

item.title: McGraw Hill and NIQ to test appetite for IPOs by mature companies with billions in sales
item.description: The digital education company and the consumer researcher have histories on Wall Street and are backed by private-equity firms.

item.title: California is set to become the first US state to manage power outages with AI
item.description: California’s statewide power grid operator is poised to become the first in North America to deploy artificial intelligence to manage outages, MIT Tec...

item.title: Stop vetting engineers like it’s 2021 — the AI-native workforce has arrived
item.description: Jobs will fade and rise due to AI. But those who learn to screen, train and build dev teams around AI-enabled talent will write the future.

item.title: The human harbor: Navigating identity and meaning in the AI age
item.description: The future is marked by deepening uncertainty about our place in it, and by growing ambiguity about the nature of human purpose itself.

item.title: Pharm Robotics advances automated dairy cow healthcare
item.description: Pharm Robotics' Sureshot automates cow vaccinations and treatments with robotics, 3D vision, and AI for optimal dairy herd health. The post Pharm Robo...

item.title: Building voice AI that listens to everyone: Transfer learning and synthetic speech in action
item.description: Enterprises adopting voice AI must consider not just usability, but inclusion. Supporting users with disabilities is a market opportunity.

item.title: BlackBerry QNX is optimistic on robotic surgery but says autonomy isn’t here yet
item.description: QNX BlackBerry's Jim Hirsch shares insights about the current state of precision, AI, and the surgical robotics market. The post BlackBerry QNX is opt...

item.title: Apera AI updates Apera Forge design and AI training studio
item.description: Apera AI said the platform enables manufacturers and integrators to build and validate vision-guided robotic applications. The post Apera AI updates A...

item.title: A new paradigm for AI: How ‘thinking as optimization’ leads to better general-purpose models
item.description: A new AI model learns to "think" longer on hard problems, achieving more robust reasoning and better generalization to novel, unseen tasks.

item.title: The first babies have been born following “simplified” IVF in a mobile lab
item.description: This week I’m sending congratulations to two sets of parents in South Africa. Babies Milayah and Rossouw arrived a few weeks ago. All babies are speci...
